hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1240 a.n today's date is March
28th 2017 and the title of the episode
is the push to expose secret inner
workings of the Fed is underway now
before I get started I just want to make
an announcement I uploaded an interview
with Brandon Smith it is on the x-22
report spotlight YouTube channel so just
go over to YouTube type in x-22 report
spotlight you'll see the interview there
or you can come over to x-22 report comm
sites scroll down a little bit look over
to the right hand side you can play the
video right on the side or go to News
Sentinel dot-com same things scroll down
a little bit look over to your right
hand side and you can play the video
there let's get into the economic
collapse financial news today we see the
chaos is continuing but this time the
market has been pushed up and we're
going to see this as we move forward the
markets going to be up it's going to be
down we're gonna see a lot of chaos as
we move forward and what's very
interesting about all this well first of
all gold was suppressed a little bit it
was brought down but what we're seeing
right now and this is coming from the
conference board The Conference Board
consumer confidence and again they get
grants from the government and they
basically do whatever the government
wants and right now we can see the
consumer confidence coming from the
conference board well it has surged to
one hundred and twenty five point six
now we haven't seen anything like this
since 2000 and when you really look at
the consumer confidence it's continually
moving up as retail stores are closing
people are being laid off and real
earnings growth is declining but people
are very confident confident in what
well they see the stock market moving up
maybe they're confident in that but real
earnings growth that's declining retail
stores are closing
people are being laid off in retail and
when we look at the human confidence
well we see this divided between
Democrats and Republicans Democrats well
they're expecting a deep recession
Republic
well they're expecting a new era of
robust economic growth but the last time
Americans felt this good about stocks
about the economy well the dot-com
bubble burst two months later and think
about this back in 2008 when the stock
market was hitting like 14,000 points
and people were feeling good what
happened later on remember that month of
August I believe it was August when we
had Obama and McCain and McCain was out
there trying to tell everyone that the
economy was fine yes Obama said he
doesn't believe the economy is doing
that's pretty much what he said at that
point and then all of a sudden as we
approached September and then we hit
October the market came down McCain boom
he had no clue he was not in touch with
what the economy was doing they knew
Obama somehow knew that the economy
wasn't doing well and things were going
to fall apart hmm very interesting that
pretty much got him into the White House
I mean there were other factors like
that but we had the stock market at
14,000 points the Fed told us everything
and then everything started to fall
apart very rapidly today we see the same
thing happening I mean Case Shiller came
out telling us that us home prices well
they have accelerated at its fastest
pace in three years and of course they
look at the 20 cities and they say yes
look at this we're able to get these 20
cities and were able to push the home
prices up five by five point seven
percent now it's very interesting about
all of this again is that mortgage rates
have been moving up a little bit
mortgage applications have been down but
prices are continually moving up Las
Vegas siano San Diego they led the
monthly gains while Cleveland
Minneapolis in Detroit they saw a
slowdown San Francisco saw the biggest
drop in a year
now remember Case Shiller is reporting
on this a couple months back since that
time mortgage applications have declined
rates have popped up a little bit and
when you look outside of the 20 cities
we are
seeing that prices are coming down when
I look around my area I can see there
are homes that have been for sale for a
very long time and guess what this past
Sunday I was driving around and I saw
open houses all over the place and
nobody was showing up and when I look
across the country I can see pretty much
the same exact thing now
Americans they have paid a record five
hundred and forty billion dollars in
property taxes to state and local
governments in the fiscal year of 2016
this is according to the US Census
Bureau this was up by 16 billion dollars
or about 3.2 percent from five hundred
and twenty three billion in property
taxes back in 2015 so what we're seeing
right now is that we've seen the
property taxes hit this height it hit a
new level here and we saw it back in
2009 when they hit 527 billion so right
now property taxes are about thirteen
billion dollars higher than they were at
the Great Recession period of time and
we can see that everything is reaching
that height level once again and when we
look around we can see there are major
problems in the economy look at New York
City retail vacancies for instance and
if you walk around Soho and you used to
walk around Soho and you see you know
dozen upstart trendy fashion retailers
and you'd see all these different stores
but today what do you see well you see a
lot of vacancies you see a retail
drought and commercial landlords well
they've seen retail occupancy levels
plummet over the last 12 months and
they're doing everything possible to
avoid big price cuts instead like
residential landlords commercial real
estate owners well they're providing
massive rent concessions through things
like interior redesigns
moving expenses to keep storefronts from
going empty we're seeing tenant
improvement in concession packages that
retail landlords never ever contemplated
before and 5th Avenue stores well
that is on the rise and they are going
empty right now the space availability
right now is increasing in New York and
again as more and more of these retail
shops closed down across the country pay
less Sears
RadioShack we're gonna have a lot of
space that it will be opening up and we
already have a glut of retail space and
it's just getting worse we see more
signs of a weakening economy the Census
Bureau advanced economic reports show
that host sale and retail inventories
each Rove's by 0.4 percent this
inventory build will likely add a couple
of ticks to GDP estimates but sales
really haven't matched it the trade
deficit shrank in February but not
because of export strength but because
of both exports and imports were
negative for the month and imports fell
less and we see right now the decline in
imports well it adds to the weakening
consumer spending outlook especially
with the auto sector already rolling
over so things are rapidly deteriorating
things are not getting better
things aren't improving actually what
we're seeing is things are getting worse
now Charles Hughes Smith he wrote an
article the overlapping crises are
coming regardless of who's in power
right now
and Timothy Geithner well he conceded
that in his recent foreign affairs
article on handle deal the next global
financial crisis that the central banks
and states have expanded all their
ammunition lowering interest rates
creating money out of thin air to
bolster systemic liquidity buying bonds
and other assets to prop up shaky
markets and barring immense sums to prop
up government spending and there is
little left for the next crisis and I
don't like doing this but I have to
agree with Tim Geithner on this that it
looks like the central banks they have
nothing left to shoot off they have no
more grenades they have no more bullets
and we can see that the Fed right now
they are raising the rates which is a
signal to let you know that they're
preparing to bring this entire system
down
we see there is top Republicans out
there saying that a government shutdown
is a real possibility and Wall Street
might not be prepared for this and we
know that is coming up because once we
hit the 20 trillion and it looks like
it's going to hit around maybe April
28th around that time period and we can
see that there's going to be a battle
look what happened with the healthcare
battle there's going to be a battle with
the debt ceiling and we'll have to see
how this all plays out because right now
the Democrats they feel empowered right
now where they're saying look we still
have Obamacare the debt ceiling is
coming up next let's not make it easy
for Trump and we can see that the deep
state their entire mission is to make
sure that their system collapses by
shutting down the government well they
just have another method of really
twisting all of this and putting a lot
of pressure on the economy to bring it
down now we know when Ron Paul was in
office he kept on pushing the idea that
we need to audit the and he continually
pushed this and his son Rand Paul well
he is also pushing this now we know
there was a bill floating around to look
into the secret dealings of the Fed and
we can see right now that the US House
committee well they approved a bill to
go in and audit the Fed now does this
mean they can go in and order the Fed
right now no but we do know that the
entire house it's made up mostly of
Republicans they control it and they
might move this bill forward because we
understand that the next phase is for
the entire floor to vote on it now there
are certain individuals in government
that do not want this to happen and
these individuals are the pawns of the
deep state of the central bank they
don't want an audit of the Fed they
don't want anyone looking into the
secret inner workings of what they're
actually doing remember the Fed is a
separate corporation it's not part of
the government they have their own
mandate their own secret mandate which
really nobody knows about of
what their whole entire purpose is about
it's not about the people it's not
balancing the budget it's not keeping
the currency out there and circulated
has nothing to do with that because if
they truly were working for the people
why attach interest there'd be no reason
to do it so at this point we can see the
founding fathers well they didn't want a
private central bank actually Andrew
Jackson his entire campaign was to get
rid of the central bank and he did and
of course they tried to assassinate him
this is what the central banks do when
they don't get their way they try to
kill that individual but it was too late
because he got rid of them their
assassination attempt failed and we can
see right now that Trump does have that
portrait hanging in his office and we
can see right now there are many
individuals these pawns of the central
bank and think about it why are they
defending the central bank what benefit
does it give them are they receiving
funds in a certain way
are they being you know compensated for
doing the work of the central bank and
protecting them in Congress well of
course because what other benefit is
there there is no other benefit to the
central bank and we could see around the
world if their mandate was to keep
everything at status quo and make sure
that all the countries are doing well
why are the all these countries in so
much debt why do we have 20 trillion
dollars worth of debt why do we have 200
trillion of unfunded liability why do
they keep giving debt to countries and
making the people pay for it think about
all of it now are they going to be able
to audit the Fed will it get that far
no the central bank the deep state
they're pretty powerful and we know for
a very long time they do not want to be
audited they believe that it's none of
the people's business
really we the people it's none of our
business how the currency of this
country is working and what the Fed is
actually doing now the books they give
to Congress saying this is more audit
those aren't the books we want to look
at we want to look at the other book
that they have the other accounting that
they have we've seen this before in
companies actually where they give one
set of books and say look everything's
on the up-and-up and in the background
they keep the other set what with which
what they're really doing and we can see
right now
there are individuals that are going to
try to stop this they don't want the Fed
audit it because if the Fed was audited
this would be one of the biggest truth

a complete disaster for that central

central banking system it would in the
whole entire central bank system would

why it's been how many years now since
1913 that they've never let a full audit

if they're found out they're done for
just like during Andrew Jackson's time
listen to everyone thanks a lot for
